snippet: Demonstrators resumed their protests on Monday against plans to develop a $4.8 billion gold mine, saying they feared that it would harm their water supplies.
abstract: Peruvians resume protests against plans to develop a $4.8 billion gold mine in northern city of Cajamarca, saying they fear it will harm their water supplies.
lead_paragraph: Demonstrators resumed their protests on Monday against plans to develop a $4.8 billion gold mine, saying they feared that it would harm their water supplies.
